Docs.summary: Provides event notifications when root designers are added and removed, when a selected component changes, and when the current root designer changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks IDesignerEventService provides notification when a new root designer is created, changed, or disposed. A root designer provides design time support for the base component of a document in designer view. The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerEventService.SelectionChanged> event provides notification when the current component selection has changed.
## Examples This example demonstrates a designer that uses the IDesignerEventService to display event notifications on a control. To use this example, compile the code to a class library. Add a reference to the library to a new Windows Forms project, and add the control within the library to the **Toolbox**. Add an instance of the `DesignerMonitor` control to a form in design mode. Right-click the control and click the `Start monitoring` command to display notifications of events raised by the IDesignerEventService.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the current root designer changes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This event can result from the user opening or setting focus to a new document, or by closing a document.

Docs.summary: Occurs when a root designer is created.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This event is raised when a new document has been loaded and is ready for user input.

Docs.summary: Occurs when a root designer for a document is disposed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This event is raised when a document is about to be disposed, but before the document actually starts to dispose itself.

Docs.value: A containing the root designers that have been created and not yet disposed.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the current design-view selection changes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This selection changed event can result from the user changing the selection in the currently active document, or from the user switching to a new document.
